cnd11:1.2: After I heard about the heroes who have no desire for desire,
cnd11:1.3: I came to ask those who have passed the violent current, to ask the desireless ones,
cnd11:1.4: One with the born Eye, please tell me the state of silence,
cnd11:1.5: Blessed One, I ask you to tell me as it is.
cnd11:1.7: After I heard about the heroes who have no desire for desire,
cnd11:1.8: I came to ask those who have passed the violent current, to ask the desireless ones,
cnd11:1.9: One with the born Eye, please tell me the state of silence,
cnd11:1.10: Blessed One, I ask you to tell me as it is.
cnd11:1.12: After I heard about the heroes who have no desire for desire,
cnd11:1.13: I came to ask those who have passed the violent current, to ask the desireless ones,
cnd11:1.14: One with the born Eye, please tell me the state of silence,
cnd11:1.15: Blessed One, I ask you to tell me as it is.
cnd11:1.17: After I heard about the heroes who have no desire for desire,
cnd11:1.18: I came to ask those who have passed the violent current, to ask the desireless ones,
cnd11:1.19: One with the born Eye, please tell me the state of silence,
cnd11:1.20: Blessed One, I ask you to tell me as it is.
cnd11:1.22: After I heard about the heroes who have no desire for desire,
cnd11:1.23: I came to ask those who have passed the violent current, to ask the desireless ones,
cnd11:1.24: One with the born Eye, please tell me the state of silence,
cnd11:1.25: Blessed One, I ask you to tell me as it is.
cnd11:2.1: "I heard about a hero who has no desire for desire": Like this, the Blessed One,
cnd11:2.2: the Arahant..., the Buddha, after hearing it, after grasping, after
cnd11:2.3: understanding, after distinguishing. "Hero," the Blessed One is a hero, "the
cnd11:2.4: energetic" is a hero, "the able" is a hero, "the sufficient" is a hero, "the
cnd11:2.5: brave" is a hero, "heroic" is a hero, "those who are not afraid" are heroes,
cnd11:2.6: those who have no terror are heroes, those who do not run away are heroes, those
cnd11:2.7: who have given up on fear of terror are heroes.
cnd11:3.2: With vitality, after transcending the suffering of hell,
cnd11:3.4: People like this can be called a hero."
cnd11:4.1: "After I heard about the heroes who have no desire for desire": Desire is two
cnd11:4.2: types of desires: the desire for things and the desire for pollution. What are
cnd11:4.3: the desires for things? Desirable sight, sound, smell, taste, touch; bedding,
cnd11:4.4: clothing, maidservants, goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, elephants, cows,
cnd11:4.5: horses, mules, horses, fields, houses, gold, gold coins, villages and towns,
cnd11:4.6: capitals, countries, territories, treasuries, warehouses; everything that can be
cnd11:4.7: tainted by greed is the desire for things.
cnd11:5.1: In addition, there are past desires, future desires, present desires, internal
cnd11:5.2: desires, external desires, internal and external desires, inferior desires,
cnd11:5.3: medium desires, superior desires; desires in the suffering world, human desires,
cnd11:5.4: heavenly desires, existing desire, created desire, uncreated desire, created
cnd11:5.5: desire by others, possessed desire, unpossessed desire, cherished desire,
cnd11:5.6: non-cherished desires; the desires of all the worlds of desire, the desires of
cnd11:5.7: all the worlds of physicality, all the desires of the world of non-material
cnd11:5.8: worlds, dependence on thirst and desire for love, desiring righteousness, greed
cnd11:5.9: for righteousness, the desire to be intoxicated by righteousness and happiness,
cnd11:5.10: is called the desire for things.
cnd11:6.1: What is the desire for defilement? The desire for desire, the desire for greed,
cnd11:6.2: the desire of desire to greed, the desire of intention, the desire for lust, the
cnd11:6.3: desire for intention, the joy of desire, love obsession, the binding harness of
cnd11:6.4: desire, attachment, the desire for cover.
cnd11:7.2: Wanting to be produced by thought (intention),
cnd11:7.3: I will not think of them,
cnd11:8.1: For the Buddha and the Blessed One, the desire for things has been known, the
cnd11:8.2: desire for pollution has been renounced, in the state of knowing of the desire
cnd11:8.3: for things, and the desire for pollution has been renounced(, the Blessed One
cnd11:8.4: does not desire in desire; does not pray in desire; does not want in desire;
cnd11:8.5: does not ask in desire). Whoever desires in desire; prays in desire; hopes in
cnd11:8.6: desire; asks in desire, they are those who have desires for desires, those who
cnd11:8.7: have greed for greed, and those who have thoughts about desires. The Blessed One
cnd11:8.8: does not desire desires; does not want desires; does not hope for desires; does
cnd11:8.9: not ask desires. Therefore, the Buddha, those who have no desire, those who have
cnd11:8.10: renounced their desires, those who have abandoned their desires, those who have
cnd11:8.11: eliminated their desires, those who have liberated their desires, those who have
cnd11:8.12: forsaken their desires, those who have cut off their desires, those who have
cnd11:8.13: renounced greed, those who have no greed, those who have renounced greed, those
cnd11:8.14: who have eliminated greed, those who have been liberated from greed, those who
cnd11:8.15: have cut off greed, those who have forsaken greed, those who are not hungry,
cnd11:8.16: those who have extinguished, those who have become cool, those who feel happy,
cnd11:8.17: and those who live as Brāhmaṇas.
cnd11:9.1: "[Like this Venerable Jatukanṇị̄]": "Like this," the continuation of sentences;
cnd11:9.2: the connection of sentences; the completion of sentences; the combination of
cnd11:9.3: words; the connection of words; this is the order of sentences, which is "like
cnd11:9.4: this." "Venerable," this is a synonym of love, respect, respect, and obedience.
cnd11:9.5: This is "Venerable." "Jatukanṇị̄," the name, title, security, common name,
cnd11:10.1: "Come to ask the undesiring ones who have crossed the torrent (storm)": "The
cnd11:10.2: ones who have crossed the torrent," the ones who have passed the torrent, those
cnd11:10.3: who have overcome the torrent. "To ask," to ask, to question, to inquire, to
cnd11:10.4: make it clear. "Come to..., the one who has no desire," to ask the person who
cnd11:10.5: has no desire, the person who has deserted, and the person who has given up
cnd11:10.6: desire, those who have been excluded, those who have renounced their desires,
cnd11:10.7: ...(omitted), those who have renounced greed, ...(omitted), we have come, we
cnd11:10.8: have arrived, we have fully arrived, we have been united with you.
cnd11:11.1: "The one born with the Eye, please speak about the state of silence": "Silence"
cnd11:11.2: takes a form as silence and a state of silence, that is non-living, Nibbāna,
cnd11:11.3: that is the cessation of all actions, the cessation of all attachments, the
cnd11:11.4: extinction of craving, greed, extinction, Nibbāna. This is said by the Blessed
cnd11:11.5: One: "This is the state of silence, this is the state of victory, namely: the
cnd11:11.6: cessation of all actions, the cessation of all attachments, the extinction of
cnd11:11.7: thirst, freedom from greed, extinction, Nibbāna" [SN.48.50]. With another
cnd11:11.8: aspect: where all dhammas lead to the realization of silence, the touch of
cnd11:11.9: silence, and the testimony of silence, just like these four mindfulnesses and
cnd11:11.10: four righteousnesses, the four bases, the five faculties, the five powers, the
cnd11:11.11: seven enlightenment factors, and the eight branches of the holy path. These are
cnd11:11.12: called the state of silence. Please speak, please explain, ...(omitted) the
cnd11:11.13: state of silence, the state of refuge, the state of shelter the state of no
cnd11:11.14: fear, the state of no death, the state of non-living, the state of Nibbāna. The
cnd11:11.15: eye is called the state of all knowing wisdom. For the Buddha and the Blessed
cnd11:11.16: One, the eye and the state of the victor arise at the same time (not in
cnd11:11.17: sequence) under the Bodhi tree, so the Buddha is the co-born Eye.
cnd11:12.1: "Blessed One, please tell me the truth": The truth is called non-living,
cnd11:12.2: Nibbāna.... "Blessed One" is synonymous with respect. In addition, the "greed
cnd11:12.3: breaker" is the Blessed One; the "sickness destroyer" is the Blessed One; "the
cnd11:12.4: one who has destroyed conceit" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed
cnd11:12.5: the thorns" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the pollutants" is
cnd11:12.6: Blessed One; "the one who has ended" is the Blessed One; "the one who has
cnd11:12.7: practiced the body, the precepts, the mind, and the wisdom" is the Blessed One;
cnd11:12.8: or "the Blessed One is close to the woods, wild forests, and border dwellings
cnd11:12.9: (sitting place), where speaking is lessened, it is quiet, away from the human
cnd11:12.10: atmosphere, alone, and suitable for sitting alone" is the Blessed One; or "the
cnd11:12.11: Blessed One is the one who divides clothes, food, shelter, the needs of
cnd11:12.12: patients, and medical necessities"; or "the Blessed One is the one who has the
cnd11:12.13: taste of righteousness, the taste of Dhamma, the taste of liberation, the
cnd11:12.14: increased precepts, the mind, and the wisdom"; or "the Blessed One is the four
cnd11:12.15: types of jhāna, the four immeasurables, the four formlessness, etc., the one who
cnd11:12.16: divides is the Blessed One"; or the Blessed One is the one who has the eighth
cnd11:12.17: liberation, the eight victories, the ninth dwelling place, etc.; or the Blessed
cnd11:12.18: One is the practice of ten thoughts, (ten) abidings, the one who (observes) the
cnd11:12.19: in and out of breath; the one who is purely divided is the Blessed One; or the
cnd11:12.20: Blessed One divides the four mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four
cnd11:12.21: divine bases (iddhipāda), the five faculties, the five powers, the seven
cnd11:12.22: enlightenment factors, and the eight branches of the holy path; or the Blessed
cnd11:12.23: One is ten Tathāgata, four fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six
cnd11:12.24: supernatural powers and the six enlightenment methods. "Blessed One," this name
cnd11:12.25: is not given by the mother; not given by the father; not given by brothers; not
cnd11:12.26: given by sisters; not given by friends; not given by relatives; not given by
cnd11:12.27: Samaṇas or Brāhmaṇas; not given by heaven; it is ultimate liberation; the
cnd11:12.28: establishment (of the pseudonym) for the acquisition and testimony of the
cnd11:12.29: Buddha, the Blessed One, under the Bodhi tree, and all knowledge and wisdom,
cnd11:12.30: that is, the Blessed One. "Please tell me," ....
cnd11:13.1: <em>66 : Because the Blessed One acts after victory over desire,
cnd11:13.2: Like the shining sun shines on the earth,
cnd11:13.3: The one who is broadly wise, for me who is less wise,
cnd11:13.5: That I can know where there is the separation of birth and aging.
cnd11:13.6: <em>66 : Because the Blessed One acts after victory over desire,
cnd11:13.7: Like the shining sun shines on the earth,
cnd11:13.8: The one who is broadly wise, for me who is less wise,
cnd11:13.10: That I can know where there is the separation of birth and aging.
cnd11:13.11: <em>66 : Because the Blessed One acts after victory over desire,
cnd11:13.12: Like the shining sun shines on the earth,
cnd11:13.13: The one who is broadly wise, for me who is less wise,
cnd11:13.15: That I can know where there is the separation of birth and aging.
cnd11:13.16: <em>66 : Because the Blessed One acts after victory over desire,
cnd11:13.17: Like the shining sun shines on the earth,
cnd11:13.18: The one who is broadly wise, for me who is less wise,
cnd11:13.20: That I can know where there is the separation of birth and aging.
cnd11:13.21: <em>66 : Because the Blessed One acts after victory over desire,
cnd11:13.22: Like the shining sun shines on the earth,
cnd11:13.23: The one who is broadly wise, for me who is less wise,
cnd11:13.25: That I can know where there is the separation of birth and aging.
cnd11:14.1: "Because the Blessed One acts after the victory over desire": "Blessed One,"
cnd11:14.2: .... "Desire," .... After the Blessed One has known the desires of things, after
cnd11:14.3: giving up on the desires for pollution, he defeated, ceased, overwhelmed, ended,
cnd11:14.4: crushed, is walking, staying, acting, going on, guarding, surviving.
cnd11:15.1: "The shining sun shines on the earth": The sun (ādicco) is called the sun
cnd11:15.2: (sūriyo). The earth (pathavī) is called the earth (jagatī). The shining sun has
cnd11:15.3: brilliance, wins, defeats, overwhelms, ending, heating the earth, breaking
cnd11:15.4: through all the darkness in the sky, destroying the darkness, after the light is
cnd11:15.5: seen, walking in the sky, in the air, and on the road in the void; similarly,
cnd11:15.6: the shining Blessed Wisdom has the brilliance of wisdom, (destroying) all works,
cnd11:15.7: ...the darkness of pollution, destroys the darkness of ignorance, after seeing
cnd11:15.8: the light of wisdom, after knowing the desire for things, after giving up on the
cnd11:15.9: desire for pollution, he wins, defeats, overwhelms, ends, crushes, walks, stays,
cnd11:15.10: acts, goes on, guards, and survives.
cnd11:16.1: "The one who is broadly wise, for the one who is less wise": I am the one who is
cnd11:16.2: less wise, the lower, and inferior in wisdom; you are the wiser, the higher, the
cnd11:16.3: quicker, and the insightful. As the earth is called wide, the Blessed One has
cnd11:16.4: the same vast and expanding wisdom as that earth.
cnd11:17.1: "Please explain the Dhamma that I can know": "Dhamma," .... Please explain,
cnd11:17.2: please teach.... "I can know," I can know, know with certainty, penetrate,
cnd11:18.1: "Where is the renunciation of birth and senescence": The renunciation of birth,
cnd11:18.2: aging, and death, cessation, severance, stopping, non-living, and Nibbāna.
cnd11:19.2: Please temper your craving of desire,
cnd11:19.3: And treat detachment from desire as stability,
cnd11:19.5: Don't let these be found (in you).
cnd11:19.7: Please temper your craving of desire,
cnd11:19.8: And treat detachment from desire as stability,
cnd11:19.10: Don't let these be found (in you).
cnd11:19.12: Please temper your craving of desire,
cnd11:19.13: And treat detachment from desire as stability,
cnd11:19.15: Don't let these be found (in you).
cnd11:19.17: Please temper your craving of desire,
cnd11:19.18: And treat detachment from desire as stability,
cnd11:19.20: Don't let these be found (in you).
cnd11:19.22: Please temper your craving of desire,
cnd11:19.23: And treat detachment from desire as stability,
cnd11:19.25: Don't let these be found (in you).
cnd11:20.2: temper craving of desire": Please adjust the greed of desire, please expel,
cnd11:20.3: please leave, please drive away, please make to end, please make it go to
cnd11:22.1: "After, see detachment from desire as stability": "(Leaving) desire," the
cnd11:22.2: correct way, the following way, the non-reverse way, the way of
cnd11:22.3: non-contradiction, the way of the Way and the Dhamma, it means to follow the
cnd11:22.4: path of the Dhamma, complete the precepts, guard the roots, know the right
cnd11:22.5: amount of food, specialize in sobriety, mindfulness, with right knowledge, four
cnd11:22.6: mindfulnesses, four right diligences, four divine bases, five senses, five
cnd11:22.7: powers, seven enlightenment factors, eight holy paths, Nibbāna and the path
cnd11:22.8: leading to Nibbāna, they are stability, shelter, fearless, deathless,
cnd11:22.9: non-living, Nibbāna; after seeing, weighing, judging, separating, and
cnd11:23.1: "Pick up or reject": "Picked up," held on, clung to, clinging, taken, believed
cnd11:23.2: to be due to craving, seeing. "Or rejected," or rejected what should be
cnd11:23.3: detached, what should be abandoned, what should be driven away, what should be
cnd11:23.4: terminated, what should be brought to non-existence.
cnd11:24.1: "To not find anything": "Anything," greed is a thing, hatred is a thing,
cnd11:24.2: ignorance ...(omitted); any of these things, don't be discovered, don't be
cnd11:24.3: forced to be discovered, don't be completely discovered, don't be discovered,
cnd11:24.4: please abandon, please drive away, please make the end, please make it go to
cnd11:25.1: <em>68 : Anything before, please let it wither;
cnd11:25.3: If you will not hold it in the middle,
cnd11:25.4: You will live a silent life.
cnd11:25.5: <em>68 : Anything before, please let it wither;
cnd11:25.7: If you will not hold it in the middle,
cnd11:25.8: You will live a silent life.
cnd11:25.9: <em>68 : Anything before, please let it wither;
cnd11:25.11: If you will not hold it in the middle,
cnd11:25.12: You will live a silent life.
cnd11:25.13: <em>68 : Anything before, please let it wither;
cnd11:25.15: If you will not hold it in the middle,
cnd11:25.16: You will live a silent life.
cnd11:26.1: "Anything before, please make it wither": As for the pollution that can cause
cnd11:26.2: pollution in the past, please make it dry, please make it wither, please make it
cnd11:26.3: dry up, do not make seeds, please let it go, please drive away, please end it,
cnd11:26.4: please make it go to non-existence. In this way, what was before, please let it
cnd11:26.5: wither. Or, any past kamma creations that have not matured and repaid, please
cnd11:26.6: let them wither, I ask you to wither, ...make it to go to non-existence.
cnd11:27.1: "Please don't have any afterwards": Afterwards is called the future. Regarding
cnd11:27.2: the actions of the future, what can arise, any greed, any aversion, any
cnd11:27.3: delusion, any conceit, any perception, any pollution, any evil deeds, any of
cnd11:27.4: these, you should not have, don't make, don't produce, don't generate, don't
cnd11:27.5: cause to arise, please give up, please drive away, please make to end, please
cnd11:27.6: make it to come to non-existence.
cnd11:28.1: "If you can't hold the one in the middle": The one in the middle is called the
cnd11:28.2: present form, feeling, thought, action, and consciousness. Regarding the present
cnd11:28.3: actions, you will not hold it because of craving and seeing, thirst, grasping,
cnd11:28.4: clinging, rejoicing, welcoming, holding, you will give up, drive away, end, and
cnd11:29.1: "You will live a silent life": The silent state of greed means that you will
cnd11:29.2: live a silent life, an unagitated... (omitted) all unwholesome contrived things,
cnd11:29.3: silent states, calmed states, dead state, the extinguished state, the no longer
cnd11:29.4: burning state, the cooled state, the gone state, the ceased state is silent,
cnd11:29.5: quiet, extinguished, cooled, stopped; you live, act, go on, guard, and survive.
cnd11:30.1: <em>69 : For those who are free from greed
cnd11:30.2: In all names and forms, Brāhmaṇa,
cnd11:30.3: For this one troubles are not found
cnd11:30.4: With which he would reach the control of death.
cnd11:30.5: <em>69 : For those who are free from greed
cnd11:30.6: In all names and forms, Brāhmaṇa,
cnd11:30.7: For this one troubles are not found
cnd11:30.8: With which he would reach the control of death.
cnd11:30.9: <em>69 : For those who are free from greed
cnd11:30.10: In all names and forms, Brāhmaṇa,
cnd11:30.11: For this one troubles are not found
cnd11:30.12: With which he would reach the control of death.
cnd11:30.13: <em>69 : For those who are free from greed
cnd11:30.14: In all names and forms, Brāhmaṇa,
cnd11:30.15: For this one troubles are not found
cnd11:30.16: With which he would reach the control of death.
cnd11:31.1: "In all names and forms, Brāhmaṇa! For those who are free from greed":
cnd11:31.2: "Everything," .... "Name," the four formless aggregates. "Form," the four great
cnd11:31.3: elements and any form derived from the four great elements. Craving is called
cnd11:31.4: craving, it is greed, .... "In all names and forms, Brāhmaṇa! For those who have
cnd11:31.5: no greed": In all names and forms, to those who renounce greed, those who have
cnd11:31.6: no greed, those who abandon greed, those who exclude greed, those who are
cnd11:31.7: liberated from greed, and those who forsake greed, dismiss the greed, abandon
cnd11:31.8: the greed, cut off the greed, free the greed.
cnd11:32.1: "For this one, troubles are not discovered": "Trouble," there are four types of
cnd11:32.2: troubles: the troubles of desire, the troubles of being, the troubles of seeing
cnd11:32.3: (views), and the troubles of ignorance. "For this one," the Arahant, those who
cnd11:32.4: have exhausted their troubles. "Undiscovered," these troubles are not, are
cnd11:32.5: non-existent, unknown, not found, cut off, severed, calmed down, stopped, unable
cnd11:32.6: to arise, and burned by the fire of wisdom.
cnd11:33.1: "With which he will reach the control of the king of death": With those troubles
cnd11:33.2: that will make him go to the control of the Demon King, or go under the control
cnd11:33.3: of death, they will go to the control of the demon faction; those troubles are
cnd11:33.4: not, are non-existent, and not controlled by him, not known, not being
cnd11:33.5: discovered, being cut off, being severed, being calmed down, being stopped,
cnd11:33.6: unable to arise, being burned by the fire of wisdom.
cnd11:34.1: At the end of these verses... "The Blessed One is my teacher, I am a disciple."
